item.title: Post excerpts | mdsh
item.description: An easier way to show snippets, excerpts or previews of your blog posts on other parts of your site.<!--1558897183-->

item.title: New site navigation | mdsh
item.description: A new template has been added which creates a nice menu, for easier site navigation, and which has been added into the site footer by default.<!--1558897183-->

item.title: Mustache templating | mdsh
item.description: Templates are now used to generate the HTML pages, which required a very extensive re-write of mdsh.<!--1558897183-->

item.title: More responsive pages | mdsh
item.description: Each page created using `mdsh` now gives you some extra CSS classes to work with, so you can more easily target specific browsers and devices.<!--1558897183-->

item.title: Improving structured data | mdsh
item.description: All generated index pages, which list posts, authors, categories and tags, now have improved structured data, in the form of a JSON-LD ItemList in the head of the page, which lists all items on the page. This should help your site get those nice carousels in Google search results.<!--1558897183-->

item.title: Syntax highlighting using Pygments | mdsh
item.description: I've added a super simple way to enable colourful code syntax highlighting for any code blocks you publish (requires Pygments to be installed, which needs Python). No JavaScript is required by the visitors browser, as the highlighting is done at build time.<!--1558897183-->

item.title: Dynamic search page using Jets | mdsh
item.description: I've added a search.html page, which is auto-generated by the `rebuild` command, so users can search the website and its posts more easily. The results are presented in a nice list, just like a normal search engine results page.<!--1558897183-->

item.title: Improving SEO with JSON-LD Breadcrumbs | mdsh
item.description: Using linked data breadcrumbs, we can help search engines map the structure of our site, and owrk out the relationships between pages.<!--1558897183-->

item.title: Unpublishing pages | mdsh
item.description: An easy way to hide pages on the site, without deleting them, so you can continue working on them, or publish them again later.<!--1558897183-->

item.title: Added a `.gitignore` file | mdsh
item.description: Only HTML, CSS, JS and other site assets will be deployed to the server - all source files remain on the local machine only.<!--1558897183-->

item.title: Adding HTML and CSS minification | mdsh
item.description: A new feature has been added to `mdsh` which will improve site performance: automatic minification of the generated HTML and CSS.<!--1558897183-->

item.title: Fixing code formatting | mdsh
item.description: Another IFS based fix for processing input while retaining any whitespace.<!--1558897183-->

item.title: Enabling easier Markdown re-building | mdsh
item.description: A new script called `mdsh2md` has been added to the suite of commands available in `mdsh`. This new script makes it easy to build valid Markdown files from the custom `mdsh` format files used when writing posts.<!--1558897183-->

item.title: Setting up your blog | mdsh
item.description: I've added a couple of scripts that make the initial setup of your blog easier, as well as running the web server.<!--1558897183-->

item.title: Highlighting search terms on the page | mdsh
item.description: Using a small Cash-JS plugin (adapted from a jQuery plugin), we can easily highlight the users given search terms where they are found on the page.<!--1558897183-->

item.title: Custom CSS and JS for every page | mdsh
item.description: A simple solution for adding custom CSS and JavaScript to any page or post you create using `mdsh` has now been implemented.<!--1558897183-->

item.title: Searching this website | mdsh
item.description: I've made it easier to search the website, by enabling Jets powered site search on more pages.<!--1558897183-->

item.title: Fixing RSS generation | mdsh
item.description: The differences between the GNU and BSD version of `date`, `find` and `sed` caused the RSS feed generation to fail on Mac OS X. So here is how I fixed it.<!--1558897183-->
